## R Markdown



```{r Data Cleaning and Decomp}
data <- read.csv("credit.csv")
library(fpp3)
library(lubridate)
year <- c()
for(i in 1:41){
  year[i] <- 1980+i
}
year <- rep(year,12)
year <- year[order(year, decreasing=TRUE)]

data$date <- paste(year,data$date)
data$date <- ym(data$date)

data$date<-yearmonth(data$date)

colnames(data)[2] <- "date"

colnames(data)[1] <- "credit"


data <- tsibble(data, index=date)


holdout <- tail(data, 5)
train <-  head(data, nrow(data)-5)

data %>% 
  model(classical_decomposition(credit, type = 'additive')) %>% 
  components() %>% 
  autoplot()
autoplot(data)


```



```{r Models}
lambda <- data %>% 
  features(data$credit, features = guerrero) %>% 
  pull(lambda_guerrero)

data <- data %>% 
  mutate(bc = box_cox(data$credit, lambda))


data %>% 
  autoplot(bc)
data %>%
  gg_tsdisplay(bc)

fit <- train %>% 
  model(
    TSLM(credit~trend()+season()),
    arima = ARIMA(credit),
    ets = ETS(credit),
    nnet = NNETAR(credit)
  )
fit%>% 
  forecast(h = 3, times = 0) %>% 
  accuracy(data) %>% 
  arrange(RMSE)

fit <- data%>%
  model(TSLM(credit~trend()+seasonn()))

fit %>%
  forecast(holdout, times=100)%>%
  autoplot(data)

fit %>%
  forecast(data)%>%
  autoplot(data)
gg_tsresiduals(fit)


report(fit)
```
